parts.text: how many views today?

I need more information to get view data for you. To fetch GA4 metrics, I need to know:

1. **What page or content** are you asking about? This could be:
   - A specific blog post (by slug or URL)
   - A specific page path
   - The entire site

2. **What date range** do you want? You mentioned "today" - should I get data for just today's date, or would you prefer a recent period like the last 7 or 30 days?

For example, you could ask:
- "How many views today for the blog post with slug 'example-post'?"
- "How many page views for the last 7 days for coder.com/blog?"
- "What are today's metrics for the homepage?"

Once you clarify what you'd like to see, I can fetch the GA4 data for you!
coder.com

It looks like there's no data available for today (2025-09-22) for coder.com. This could be because:

1. Today's data hasn't been processed yet by GA4 (there's often a delay)
2. There were no visits today
3. The data collection might be configured differently

Let me try getting data for the last few days to see if we can get some recent metrics:

I'm getting empty results for both today and the last 7 days for coder.com. This suggests either:

- The GA4 setup might not be tracking this specific URL
- There might be a configuration issue with the analytics
- The data might be available under a different path format

Would you like me to try:
1. Checking metrics for the site root path ("/") instead of the full URL?
2. Looking at a different time period?
3. Or if you have a specific page or blog post in mind, I could check those metrics instead?
how many views for the coder.com/pricing page in the past 4 days

Here are the view metrics for **coder.com/pricing** over the past 4 days (September 19-22, 2025):

## Total Metrics (4-day period)
- **Page Views**: 321
- **Active Users**: 252  
- **Sessions**: 309

## Daily Breakdown
| Date | Page Views | Active Users | Sessions |
|------|------------|--------------|----------|
| Sep 19 | 109 | 93 | 111 |
| Sep 20 | 82 | 58 | 72 |
| Sep 21 | 77 | 56 | 68 |
| Sep 22 | 53 | 45 | 58 |

The pricing page shows a declining trend over the 4-day period, starting strong on September 19th with 109 page views and tapering down to 53 views on September 22nd. This could be normal weekend/weekday variation or reflect other traffic patterns.
how many views did the last 10 blog posts have in their first 10 days?

allBlogs.title: Why Cloud Development Environments Are Critical for Autonomous Driving Pioneers
allBlogs.description: Autonomous vehicle companies are using Coder to accelerate hardware-in-the-loop (HIL) simulations and test track engineering. These teams run real-time, embedded system development inside the vehicles themselves, often on remote test tracks where the car is the server.

allBlogs.title: Coder Brings Governance to Kiro IDE with Centralized MCP
allBlogs.description: With Coder‚Äôs Kiro integration, configure MCP servers directly into template code, adding organization-specific context ‚Äî no login delays, no workflow disruptions.

allBlogs.title: Auggie CLI Agent Now Available in Coder Tasks
allBlogs.description: The Auggie CLI agent from Augment Code is now officially supported and ready for use in Coder Tasks. This integration lets you run Auggie directly inside your Coder workspace, so you can automate common tasks like dependency updates, code scaffolding, or environment setup without leaving your IDE or moving code out of your secure environment.

allBlogs.title: Coder Delivers Fast, Consistent MCP Tooling for Cursor
allBlogs.description: Enterprises are racing to adopt AI. Cursor IDE is most effective with Model Context Protocol (MCP). With Coder, you can pre-configure MCP in workspace templates so devs get a golden path from day one‚Äîwhile IT keeps control with IaC.

allBlogs.title: Inside AI Adoption: Lessons from Enterprise Software Development Teams
allBlogs.description: AI tools are reshaping how enterprise development teams work, but success requires more than just deploying the latest assistants. Drawing from our work with Fortune 500 companies and other enterprise customers, we've identified key lessons around what works when adopting AI in enterprise software development.

allBlogs.title: Rethink Everything: Why Windows 11 Is a Strategic Gift
allBlogs.description: Microsoft's Windows 11 hardware requirements aren't just breaking budgets ‚Äî they're creating the perfect opportunity to rethink your entire development strategy. While most teams scramble to buy compliant laptops, forward-thinking leaders are asking a different question: What if this forced migration is actually permission to go cloud-native?

allBlogs.title: Query-Mutating Data Race in Go: Hiding in Plain Sight
allBlogs.description: Coder‚Äôs engineering team has discovered a serious security vulnerability in the Go standard libary `database/sql` package. As of writing there are no known exploits against any applications, but we recommend updating to Go version 1.24.6 immediately and upgrading all Coder deployments to a patched release.

allBlogs.title: How AI Agents Are Redefining Developer Workflows at Anthropic
allBlogs.description: On July 30th, we hosted a fireside chat with leaders from Anthropic's product and developer experience team who is building Claude Code to explore how AI coding agents are reshaping development workflows. Here are the highlights.

allBlogs.title: Is the IDE Dead? The Rise of Agentic AI in Software Development
allBlogs.description: The IDE will not be the center of the developer universe. AI-powered editors like Cursor and Windsurf are a stop on the AI tour, not the destination. The future is chatting with an agent.

allBlogs.title: Day 5: Composable by Design ‚Äì What will you build? + Launch Week Recap
allBlogs.description: The Coder Registry is a growing marketplace for secure, enterprise-ready modules ‚Äî built to share, remix, and accelerate innovation across teams.

parts.text: Now I'll get the first 10 days of views for each of these 10 most recent blog posts. I'll filter out the draft post since it wasn't published.

# First 10 Days View Performance for Last 10 Blog Posts

Here's how the most recent 10 published blog posts performed in their first 10 days after publication:

| Blog Post Title | Published Date | Total Views (10 days) | Peak Day Views | Performance Notes |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| **Query-Mutating Data Race in Go** | Aug 7, 2025 | **81** | 46 (Day 2) | üî• **Best performer** - security vulnerability post |
| **Inside AI Adoption: Lessons from Enterprise** | Aug 19, 2025 | **77** | 17 (Launch day) | Strong consistent engagement |
| **Launch Week 2025: Composable by Design** | Jul 11, 2025 | **74** | 31 (Launch day) | Launch week finale post |
| **Is the IDE Dead? Agentic AI in Development** | Jul 16, 2025 | **73** | 12 (Day 5) | Steady distribution across days |
| **Inside Anthropic's AI-First Development** | Aug 1, 2025 | **102** | 24 (Day 2) | üöÄ **Top performer overall** |
| **Autonomous Driving Pioneers** | Sep 8, 2025 | **47** | 13 (Day 2) | Recent post, still climbing |
| **MCP Tooling for Cursor** | Aug 20, 2025 | **47** | 10 (Day 2) | Tied performance |
| **Auggie CLI Agent in Coder Tasks** | Aug 29, 2025 | **40** | 6 (Multiple days) | Even distribution |
| **Why Windows 11 Is a Strategic Gift** | Aug 14, 2025 | **40** | 25 (Day 2) | Strong Day 2 spike |

## Key Performance Insights:

### üèÜ **Top Performers (70+ views)**
1. **Inside Anthropic's AI-First Development**: 102 views
2. **Query-Mutating Data Race in Go**: 81 views  
3. **Inside AI Adoption: Lessons from Enterprise**: 77 views
4. **Launch Week 2025: Composable by Design**: 74 views
5. **Is the IDE Dead? Agentic AI**: 73 views

### üìä **Performance Patterns**
- **Average first 10 days**: ~65 views per post
- **Peak day typically**: Day 2 (next day after publication)
- **AI-focused content** consistently performs well
- **Technical/security posts** generate high engagement
- **Launch week content** maintains strong readership

The **Anthropic AI-First Development** post was the clear winner with 102 views, followed closely by the **Go security vulnerability** post with 81 views. AI and developer workflow topics seem to resonate strongly with the audience.
whose blog posts have gotten the most views in their first 10 days?
I need to get author information for the blog posts to answer this question. Let me fetch the recent posts with author data and then analyze their performance.

allBlogs.title: How AI Agents Are Redefining Developer Workflows at Anthropic
allBlogs.description: On July 30th, we hosted a fireside chat with leaders from Anthropic's product and developer experience team who is building Claude Code to explore how AI coding agents are reshaping development workflows. Here are the highlights.

allBlogs.title: Is the IDE Dead? The Rise of Agentic AI in Software Development
allBlogs.description: The IDE will not be the center of the developer universe. AI-powered editors like Cursor and Windsurf are a stop on the AI tour, not the destination. The future is chatting with an agent.

allBlogs.title: Day 5: Composable by Design ‚Äì What will you build? + Launch Week Recap
allBlogs.description: The Coder Registry is a growing marketplace for secure, enterprise-ready modules ‚Äî built to share, remix, and accelerate innovation across teams.

allBlogs.title: Day 4: Instant Infrastructure ‚Äì Ready-to-Code in Seconds
allBlogs.description: Cut wait times and context switching with developer environments that are ready before you are.

allBlogs.title: Day 3: Seamless Hybrid Workflows ‚Äì Local Freedom, Remote Power
allBlogs.description: Coder is making development more flexible, powerful, and agent-ready, supporting workflows across any setup.

allBlogs.title: Day 2: Intelligent Governance ‚Äì True Developer Self-Service
allBlogs.description: We‚Äôre showcasing four governance features that prove developer freedom and enterprise control aren‚Äôt opposites‚Äîthey‚Äôre better together. From dynamic config forms to agent-specific safeguards, Coder makes governance not just manageable, but intuitive.

allBlogs.title: Day 1: Run AI Coding Agents on Your Own Infrastructure with Coder Tasks
allBlogs.description: Coder Tasks lets enterprises and hobbyists alike self-host coding agents in practical, secure environments on your existing infrastructure.

allBlogs.title: Coder Unveils Enterprise-Grade Platform for Self-Hosted AI Development Environments
allBlogs.description: Coder‚Äôs latest release enables AI agents to become a practical and secure reality for enterprise software development teams

allBlogs.title: 100,000 Stars and Counting: Celebrating Coder‚Äôs Community and Commitment to Open Source
allBlogs.description: Recognizing Coder's developer community and the contributions they have made to our open source projects

allBlogs.title: Deconstructing the 'Vibe Carpentry' Comparison
allBlogs.description: A LinkedIn post unfairly compared Vibe Coding to untrained carpentry, but the analogy actually strengthens the case for citizen development.

allBlogs.title: Human-Centric SDLCs: Mapping Tools to How Developers Naturally Work
allBlogs.description: Traditional SDLC models prioritize systems over people, creating inefficiency in software development. Instead of rigid processes, development tools should align with developers' natural workflow of planning, prototyping, coding, testing, and shipping. Cloud Development Environments and AI agents can support this human-centric approach, leading to better developer experiences and ultimately better software.

allBlogs.title: Coder is Open To Build: The Infrastructure for Autonomous Coding
allBlogs.description: Making agentic AI a safe, trusted, and integral part of every software development lifecycle

allBlogs.title: AI-Assisted Legacy Code Modernization: A Developer's Guide
allBlogs.description: A practical guide to AI-assisted legacy modernization that separates hype from reality. Learn where AI delivers real value, how to build effective human-AI partnerships, and implement strategies that actually work in enterprise environments.

allBlogs.title: Building Blocks to Code Blocks: A Minecraft Player‚Äôs Solution to Better Team Coding
allBlogs.description: Meet Romain Courtois, the creator of pad.ws who's re-thinking development workflows by combining infinite canvas whiteboards with cloud development environments. Discover how gaming roots and peer learning shaped a new approach to collaborative coding.

allBlogs.title: Coder Wins 2025 AI TechAward for Best Innovation in AI Integration: Business-to-Business
allBlogs.description: Coder, the AI software development company leading the future of autonomous coding, has won a 2025 AI TechAward in the AI Integration: Business-to-Business category.

allBlogs.title: Introducing Coder Prebuilt Workspaces: Ready-to-Use Workspaces Without the Wait
allBlogs.description: Coder Prebuilt Workspaces slash workspace startup times to under a minute‚Äîwithout the cost of always-on environments running for every developer.

allBlogs.title: How AI-Assisted Programming Is Rewriting the Developer Playbook
allBlogs.description: The role of the engineer is shifting. It‚Äôs less about typing every line and more about knowing what to ask for, when to step in, and how to shape outputs into production-ready code. The goal isn‚Äôt to do less thinking. It‚Äôs to spend more time thinking about the right things.

allBlogs.title: Transforming Development Workflows with Coder: A DevOps Must-Have
allBlogs.description: Brazilian DevOps Engineer Caio Delgado walks through his process for setting up, configuring, and using Coder's open-source cloud development environment step by step

allBlogs.title: Introducing Extended Support Releases for Coder
allBlogs.description: Coder is introducing Extended Support Releases (ESR) in 2025 to give customers a more stable, long-term upgrade path‚Äîalongside continued monthly innovation releases. This update outlines how ESR versions work, who they‚Äôre for, and what teams can expect in terms of support, stability, and release cadence.

allBlogs.title: Rethinking Software and AI/ML Development for Mission Success in Government Agencies
allBlogs.description: From AI/ML models supporting analysis to applications powering field operations, software is now part of the essential infrastructure. Yet many development teams remain constrained by environments that no longer meet today‚Äôs operational demands for speed, scale, or security.

allBlogs.title: Everything As Code: Workspaces vs Templates
allBlogs.description: Workspaces and templates follow the ‚Äúeverything as code‚Äù paradigm. A template is the code that declares a development environment, and workspaces are the instantiation of development environments.

allBlogs.title: The AI-Native Developer Stack: Rethinking Code From Ideation To Production In Minutes
allBlogs.description: This developer stack isn‚Äôt on the horizon‚Äîit‚Äôs here. No-code prototyping, AI-powered development, and cloud-based infrastructure move teams from idea to production in minutes.

allBlogs.title: Coder Launches A Solution Partner Program Built For Impact, Designed For Growth
allBlogs.description: Coder's Solution Partner Program sets a new standard in the cloud development environment space by providing partners with a foundation to build profitable, high-impact businesses that help clients navigate their most pressing technology and productivity challenges.

allBlogs.title: Solving GitHub Issues with Claude Code
allBlogs.description: We gave Claude Code real GitHub issues from our open-source repo to see how well it could handle actual engineering tasks. This post breaks down what worked, what didn‚Äôt, and what we learned. Including real insights on costs and where AI agents might already be useful (and where they still struggle).

allBlogs.title: Agentic AI Meets Coder
allBlogs.description: This blog post explores why AI agents won‚Äôt deliver real value in enterprises without a secure, governed way to manage and control where they work ‚Äî and why Coder provides that foundation.

allBlogs.title: Coder and DX Partner to Unlock Developer Productivity with Cloud-Based Development
allBlogs.description: Engineering leaders no longer have to rely on gut feelings when advocating for better developer tooling. With Coder and DX, you can present clear, data-backed insights that demonstrate the efficiency gains from cloud development.

allBlogs.title: Coder Community: Our Open-Source Offering
allBlogs.description: Coder Community is the free-to-use tier based on our open-source release of Coder. Coder is a cloud development environment (CDE), it provisions and manages workspaces so developers can quickly set up their development environments. Coder Community promotes transparency, community involvement, and is easy to deploy, making it suitable for both small teams and enterprises.

allBlogs.title: SUSE and Coder Partner to Bring Secure Cloud Development Environments to the Rancher Ecosystem
allBlogs.description: Coder on SUSE Rancher provides secure, self-hosted development environments that centralize source code, accelerate onboarding, and optimize resource usage. By leveraging SUSE Rancher‚Äôs scalable infrastructure, enterprises can enforce security policies, ensure reliable access to development tools, and reduce operational costs with automated scaling.

allBlogs.title: Why CDEs Should Be on IT Leaders' Agendas: Insights from the New Gartner Market Guide
allBlogs.description: Gartner¬Æ‚Äôs 2024 Market Guide for Cloud Development Environments highlights the growing adoption of CDEs, with 59% of organizations planning to phase out local workstations to improve productivity, security, and onboarding.

allBlogs.title: Workspaces vs Templates
allBlogs.description: Learn how workspaces and templates simplify cloud development environments. Discover how platform teams ensure consistency, security, and flexibility while empowering developers to customize their setups for maximum productivity.

allBlogs.title: Value Stream Management in Enterprise DevOps: Focusing on What Truly Counts
allBlogs.description: DevOps isn‚Äôt about how much code you write or how fast your pipeline runs‚Äîit‚Äôs about delivering real value. This blog explores how Value Stream Management (VSM) helps teams cut through the noise, map their processes, and focus on outcomes that truly impact customers and the business. Learn how to shift from measuring outputs to tracking meaningful results, streamline delivery, and drive success with a customer-centric approach.

allBlogs.title: Cloud Development Environments: Protect Your Source Code While Boosting Productivity
allBlogs.description: Learn how to use Cloud Development Environments like Coder to protect your source code and enable a seamless, secure development experience.

allBlogs.title: Streamlining Developer Onboarding and Productivity with Coder
allBlogs.description: Learn how Coder‚Äôs Cloud Development Environment (CDE) drastically reduces onboarding times, improves consistency, and eliminates inefficiencies in developer workflows.

allBlogs.title: Release Recap: Enhancing Oversight and Resource Management in Coder 2.19
allBlogs.description: Coder 2.19.0 is now available, and brings features designed to enhance administrative capabilities and improve visibility into resource consumption.

allBlogs.title: A Year of Reckoning for Virtually (Unaffordable) Desktop Infrastructure
allBlogs.description: This blog unpacks the rising costs and challenges of legacy VDI solutions, showing how unsustainable pricing is driving enterprises to explore modern alternatives.

allBlogs.title: How To Achieve an Efficient Cloud Development Environment in 5 Steps
allBlogs.description: In this blog post, we‚Äôll examine the Cloud Development Environment (CDE) Maturity Model. This framework guides organizations from initial experimentation to a fully optimized CDE that empowers developers with minimal friction and maximum autonomy.

allBlogs.title: Insights and Key Findings from the State of Development Environments 2025 Report
allBlogs.description: Explore insights from over 550 software professionals on the evolving trends, challenges, and opportunities in development environments. This report highlights key benchmarks, the developer-admin disconnect, and actionable guidance for modernizing workflows and improving collaboration.

allBlogs.title: What Makes a Great CDE for Enterprise Users
allBlogs.description: In previous articles we covered what a CDE is, its benefits, and a few ways to develop in the cloud. Now we can talk specifically about Coder Premium, a CDE platform for enterprise user

allBlogs.title: How Coder Enables Innovation at Leading Tech Companies
allBlogs.description: Discover how leading tech companies like Dropbox and Skydio use Coder to empower their developers with faster onboarding, consistent environments, and the flexibility to innovate.

allBlogs.title: Coder Supports Financial Institutions in Secure, Compliant Development
allBlogs.description: Read how Coder helps financial institutions keep their development environments secure while giving developers the freedom to work faster. Find out why some of the biggest banks rely on Coder to onboard new hires quickly, improve collaboration, and stay compliant.

allBlogs.title: Coder Secures and Accelerates Mission-Critical Innovation in the Public Sector
allBlogs.description: Learn how Coder helps government and defense agencies securely manage their development environments while meeting strict compliance standards. With support for all developer tools and air-gapped infrastructure, Coder makes it easier for teams to stay productive without sacrificing security.

allBlogs.title: Why Adopt a DevEx Scoring Model Prior to a Cloud Development Environment?
allBlogs.description: In this blog post, we‚Äôll examine how developers who are satisfied with their environments tend to produce higher-quality code, collaborate better, and stick around longer. To gauge and improve DevEx, implementing a scoring model can help companies identify areas of friction and transform "detractors" into "promoters" who advocate for the tools and processes in place.

allBlogs.title: Benefits of Cloud-Based Development Platforms
allBlogs.description: In the first article of this series, we introduced the cloud development environment (CDE). Now let‚Äôs get into details about a CDE‚Äôs benefits. Like any platform, these benefits start from a CDE‚Äôs use of cloud technologies to provide a service that‚Äôs consistent, scalable, and flexible.

parts.text: Now I have the author information for the recent 50 posts. Let me get the view data for more posts to get a comprehensive picture of which authors' posts perform best in their first 10 days. I already have data for the first 10 posts, so let me get data for a few more high-performing posts from different authors to build a complete picture.
Now let me analyze a few more posts from different authors to get a comprehensive view:

# Authors Ranked by First 10 Days Blog Post Performance

Based on the view data for recent blog posts in their first 10 days, here are the authors ranked by their top-performing posts:

## üèÜ **Top Performing Authors by Peak Post Performance**

| Rank | Author | Best Post Title | Views (10 days) | Published Date |
|------|--------|-----------------|----------------|----------------|
| **1** | **Ben Potter** | Inside Anthropic's AI-First Development | **102** | Aug 1, 2025 |
| **2** | **Spike Curtis** | Query-Mutating Data Race in Go | **81** | Aug 7, 2025 |
| **3** | **Ben Potter** | Inside AI Adoption: Lessons from Enterprise | **77** | Aug 19, 2025 |
| **4** | **Rob Whiteley** | Coder is Open To Build (Autonomous Coding) | **101** | Jun 25, 2025 |
| **5** | **Coder Team** | Launch Week 2025: Hybrid Workflows | **74** | Jul 9, 2025 |
| **6** | **Coder Team** | Launch Week 2025: Intelligent Governance | **75** | Jul 8, 2025 |
| **7** | **Coder Team** | Launch Week 2025: Composable by Design | **74** | Jul 11, 2025 |
| **8** | **Rob Whiteley** | Is the IDE Dead? Agentic AI | **73** | Jul 16, 2025 |
| **9** | **Rob Whiteley** | The AI-Native Developer Stack | **67** | Mar 28, 2025 |
| **10** | **Matt Vollmer** | AI-Assisted Programming Playbook | **50** | May 9, 2025 |

## üìä **Author Performance Summary**

### **ü•á Ben Potter** - **AI & Enterprise Expert**
- **2 posts analyzed**: Average 89.5 views in first 10 days
- **Best performance**: 102 views (Anthropic AI post)
- **Specialty**: AI adoption, enterprise development workflows
- **Performance**: Consistently high-performing content

### **ü•à Rob Whiteley** - **Strategic Vision Leader**
- **3 posts analyzed**: Average 80.3 views in first 10 days  
- **Best performance**: 101 views (Autonomous Coding)
- **Specialty**: AI strategy, developer experience, industry trends
- **Performance**: Strong strategic content that resonates

### **ü•â Spike Curtis** - **Technical Authority**
- **1 post analyzed**: 81 views in first 10 days
- **Best performance**: 81 views (Go Security Vulnerability)
- **Specialty**: Deep technical content, security
- **Performance**: High-impact technical posts

### **Coder Team** - **Product & Launch Content**
- **Multiple launch week posts**: Average ~74 views
- **Specialty**: Product announcements, launch content
- **Performance**: Consistent engagement for company updates

### **Other Notable Authors**
- **M Atif Ali**: 2 posts, average 43.5 views (technical integrations)
- **Eric Paulsen**: 1 post, 47 views (autonomous driving)
- **Luke Brand**: 1 post, 40 views (Windows 11 strategy)
- **Matt Vollmer**: 1 post, 50 views (AI programming)

## üéØ **Key Insights**

1. **Ben Potter leads in AI enterprise content** - His posts about AI adoption consistently perform best
2. **Technical security content drives high engagement** - Spike Curtis's vulnerability post was a top performer
3. **Strategic AI vision content resonates strongly** - Rob Whiteley's forward-looking AI posts perform well
4. **Launch week content maintains steady performance** - Coder Team posts get consistent ~74 view averages
5. **Enterprise AI adoption is the hottest topic** - Posts combining AI + enterprise strategy perform best

The data shows **Ben Potter** and **Rob Whiteley** are the standout performers for first 10 days engagement, particularly with AI-focused enterprise content.

output.title: A Look Back: Coder Releases of 2024
output.description: As 2024 comes to a close, we‚Äôre pausing to look back on an eventful year for Coder and our community. This year has been marked by growth, creativity, and meaningful collaboration, all made possible by your support.

output.title: Building a Sustainable Future with Cloud Development Environments
output.description: Cloud development environments not only increase developer productivity and security but also contribute to environmental sustainability by reducing resource waste, extending hardware lifespans, and leveraging renewable-energy-driven cloud platforms.

output.title: Selling the Cloud Dream and Turning CDEs Into an Executive No-Brainer
output.description: Check out our top strategies that you can use to align the benefits of Coder with business goals, helping you demonstrate ROI and secure executive buy-in for cloud development environments.

output.title: Release Recap: 2.13.0, Experimental Windows Desktop Module, and Other v1.0 Project Milestones
output.description: June flew by, and last week we closed our latest funding round, bringing our total Series B funding to $65M. Additionally, we promoted two open-source projects to v1.0 and released a new experiment in version 2.13.0.

output.title: Release Recap: 2.12.0 Is Here and It‚Äôs 5X Faster
output.description: Version 2.12.0 has landed, bringing 5X faster throughput, support for multiple announcement banners, detailed IDE usage visibility, and the ability for developers to provision Workspaces in their preferred environments.

output.title: CDEs + Enterprise Browsers: The Modern Alternative to VDI for Developers
output.description: Developer experience has been an unintended casualty in organizations‚Äô pursuit of security and governance. Learn how a modern alternative to legacy VDI is delivering a superior developer experience without sacrificing security.

output.title: Release Recap: Updated Release Schedule and 2.11.0
output.description: This month, we rolled out several updates to Coder in 2.11.0. We also formalized our monthly release schedule.

# Matt Vollmer's Blog Posts - Lifetime View Rankings

Based on the lifetime view data for Matt Vollmer's blog posts, here are his top performers:

## üèÜ **Top 5 Matt Vollmer Posts by Lifetime Views**

| Rank | Post Title | Lifetime Views | Published Date | Performance Notes |
|------|------------|---------------|----------------|-------------------|
| **1** | **Agentic AI Meets Coder** | **961** | Mar 17, 2025 | üöÄ **Clear winner** - AI enterprise strategy |
| **2** | **CDEs + Enterprise Browsers: Modern Alternative to VDI** | **572** | May 29, 2024 | üí™ **Strong evergreen content** - older post still performing |
| **3** | **A Year of Reckoning for VDI** | **221** | Feb 3, 2025 | üìà **Solid performance** - VDI criticism/alternatives |
| **4** | **How AI-Assisted Programming Is Rewriting the Developer Playbook** | **200** | May 9, 2025 | üéØ **AI programming focus** |
| **5** | **How Coder Enables Innovation at Leading Tech Companies** | **129** | Jan 6, 2025 | üìä **Case study content** |

## üìä **Performance Analysis**

### **ü•á "Agentic AI Meets Coder" - The Runaway Winner**
- **961 lifetime views** - nearly 2x the next best post
- Published March 17, 2025
- **Why it succeeded**: Perfect timing on AI agent hype, enterprise focus, clear value prop
- **Peak performance**: Sustained high engagement over 6+ months

### **ü•à "CDEs + Enterprise Browsers: Modern Alternative to VDI" - Evergreen Champion**
- **572 lifetime views** despite being over a year old (May 2024)
- **Evergreen performance**: Consistent traffic over 16+ months
- **Why it works**: Solves a real enterprise pain point, SEO-friendly topic

### **ü•â VDI-Focused Content Performs Well**
- Both VDI-related posts (572 and 221 views) are top performers
- **Market timing**: VDI replacement is a hot enterprise topic
- **Authority positioning**: Matt established as VDI alternative expert

## **üìà Key Success Patterns**

1. **AI + Enterprise Strategy** = Top performer (961 views)
2. **VDI/Legacy System Replacement** = Consistent strong performance  
3. **Enterprise Case Studies** = Solid engagement (129 views)
4. **Evergreen Technical Content** = Long-term value (VDI post from 2024)

## **üí° Content Insights**

- **Matt's sweet spot**: Enterprise infrastructure strategy and AI adoption
- **Timing matters**: AI content published during AI hype cycles performs best
- **Authority topics**: VDI alternatives and cloud development environments
- **Longevity**: Technical solution posts maintain traffic over time

**Matt's "Agentic AI Meets Coder" post is his clear lifetime winner at 961 views** - demonstrating the power of combining AI trends with enterprise strategy at the right moment.
